Message.Title: republican "godfather of neoconservatism" says raise taxes on the rich
Message.Msg: Weekly Standard Editor Bill Kristol said on Sunday that the Republican Party should stop defending “a bunch of millionaires” and let the Bush-era tax cuts expire for the wealthiest Americans. “It won't kill the country if we raise taxes a little bit on millionaires,” he said on Fox News Sunday. “It really won't, I don't think. I don't really understand why Republicans don't take Obama's offer to freeze taxes for everyone below $250,000.” He continued: “Really, the Republican Party is going to fall on its sword to defend a bunch of millionaires, half of whom voted Democratic and half of whom live in Hollywood?”

Topic.Title: after the pubs take us over the fiscal cliff to bully for tax cuts for the rich

Message.Msg: if you say so, i guess. I guess you are also a numbskull who can't face up to the fact that W's tax cuts for the rich are history and they will expire as intended. btw if they were such a good idea why did bush and the gop make them temporary? " the answer is that President Bush and a complicit Congress didn’t want to show the magnitude of the deficits that would result from their tax cuts. To hide those deficits as they were pushing them through they used a variety of accounting tricks. One of those tricks was attaching expiration dates so that, on paper, there wouldn’t be any long-term costs. This made the long-term deficit picture look fairly rosy on paper even as it doomed Bush’s successor and the current Congress to cleaning up the mess."

Topic.Title: Krugman urges President Obama to go over the “fiscal cliff” if it’s necessary.

Message.Msg: Let’s Not Make a Deal .....So President Obama has to make a decision, almost immediately, about how to deal with continuing Republican obstruction. How far should he go in accommodating the G.O.P.’s demands? *** Debate (you call it obstructionism) is the crucible of democracy. Very important to prevent a rubber stamp dictatorship like the first two years of Obama. Bad things happen like $1.2T deficit with no budget for 4 years and more accumulated debt under Obama than under all prior Presidents since the founding of America. What Obama has done is create a fiscal disaster. Obama shows his incompetence for the job by resorting to partisan backstabbing instead of win-win negotiation.

Message.Title: on-line food stamp application
Message.Msg: Found this easy method to apply for foodstamps. It says: 1 in 7 Americans Have Received Food Stamps. Get Food Stamps Today. Nationwide food stamp applications and Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) applications have increased by 70% since 2007. 1 in 7 Americans are now benefiting from the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, also known as SNAP. State and federal grants that support SNAP get renewed regularly, and the SNAP budget recently received an increase of 11%. A family of six previously receiving 250 USD a month may now get 606 USD monthly. Why Apply For Food Stamps? •Because you can apply online, your application is processed faster. •The SNAP budget has increased so you can now receive more. •Thousands of food banks are available. •It is easier than ever to get food stamps! It is easier than ever to apply for food stamps today. State governments are processing food stamp applications faster because all you have to do is apply for food stamps online.
